page.title: 03RAISING TURKEYS AT HILLEND
page.content:
September is here once more with the familiar sound of turkeys chirping happily as they settle into their new surroundings. We rear 100 each year for the Christmas market.Their home for the first 6 weeks, is a redundant stock lorry container which protects them against rats and cats. They soon begin to eat a vast amount of food and grow very quickly. They are then moved to a large building up the hill.
Their short life ends when we begin killing them,a week before Christmas. This is our busiest time,the run up to the festive season.My husband,four children and myself have to work long hours,plucking,dressing and presenting the oven-ready turkeys to our many faithful customers.
